item.title: Profil de l'expert 2, – catégorie 1 (12 ans d'expérience au moins)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of Project

L’objectif global est de contribuer à la conservation de la biodiversité et des services écosystémiques pour un développement durable en Afrique de l’Ouest.

L’objectif spécifique est de renforcer durablement la conservation des écosystèmes du complexe WAP (W, Pendjari, Arly) dans une perspective régionale et avec optimisation des bénéfices pour la population riveraine.

Deux experts de catégorie 1 pour 47 jours prestés chacun dont 10 jours prestés chacun dans leur pays.

L'expert 2 aura un diplôme d'enseignement supérieur dans un des domaines suivants :

  • sciences agronomiques, forestières, biologiques ou socio-économiques (ou équivalent), L'expert devra posséder au moins 12 ans d'expérience en coopération au développement. Il devra posséder une excellente connaissance et pratique en gestion du cycle de projet / approche cadre logique. Il devra posséder une bonne connaissance des cadres institutionnels des pays africains en matière de gestion de l'environnement. L'expert devra maîtriser le français à l'écrit et à l'oral.

L'expert devra avoir les expériences spécifiques minimales suivantes :

  • avoir travaillé au moins cinq ans sur un ou des projets liés à la conservation de la nature / biodiversité ;
  • avoir réalisé au moins 2 études de formulation ou identification dans le domaine de la protection de l'environnement.
  • avoir réalisé au moins 3 évaluations externes (ex-ante, à mi-parcours ou finale)
    • avoir travaillé au moins deux ans le contexte Ouest Africain ;

Une expérience spécifique dans les domaines suivants est un plus :

  • au moins trois ans sur un ou des projets de développement de capacités institutionnelles, en lien avec le développement local ou le développement rural (environnement, agriculture, élevage, agroforesterie), et
  • avoir travaillé avec les organismes régionaux du type de l'UEMOA ou de la CEDEAO

item.title: ASiST Programme
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Purpose of role DAI’s ASiST programme is an advisory service for the European Commission rural development, food security and nutrition directorate (unit C1) within the Directorate General for Development and Cooperation (DEVCO). ASiST aims at providing support to identify and fine-tune tools to achieve the strategic objectives of food and nutrition security and sustainable agriculture in developing countries.

The ASiST Coordinator will provide direct hands-on support to the Team Leader and C1 Programme Manager to coordinate efficient delivery across the repertoire of ASiST technical and operational tasks. The role will add further value to ASiST by supporting a number of new or expanded functions, including: (i) coordinating a new technical help desk service; (ii) servicing ASiST’s knowledge management systems; and (iii) strengthening coordination and communications with internal and external stakeholders.

Key tasks and responsibilities

General operational support • Routine support to the full complement of programme activities under the supervision of the Team Leader and DEVCO C1.

• Regular liaison with the DEVCO C1 Programme Manager and core team to ensure efficient and effective activity coordination, including through attending in-person meetings at DEVCO headquarters on a flexible basis.

• Service and participate in ASiST’s frequent meetings and events, including organising venues, attendance lists, agendas, minute taking, circulating and monitoring agreed follow-up actions. These events include regular strategy meetings with DEVCO and the ASiST team as well as a range of conferences, presentations, roundtables, etc involving other DEVCO units, services and partners.

• Direct support to delivery of ASiST technical services. These include quality assurance of reports, research, studies, etc relating to ASiST’s core technical themes as well as an often significant volume of demand-driven requests from DEVCO and EU Delegations.

• Play an active role in programme process planning and improvement initiatives.

Communication and collaboration • Serve as the coordination point to facilitate ongoing technical and thematic collaboration with other relevant DEVCO units and services (such as NAS and FANSSA) around key topics and activities of mutual relevance;

• Support the team to continually promote ASiST, EU and thematic visibility, including through developing and disseminating communications materials, maintaining newsletters, etc;

• Manage ASiST’s knowledge management systems, including: coordinating and disseminating regular knowledge products; helping DEVCO C1 in organising EU InfoPoint debriefings; taking the lead role in managing ASiST content on the Capacity4Dev portal. With the latter, the junior expert will be in charge of collecting contributions from ASiST experts after each mission and updating Capacity4Dev by writing blog posts on specific insights and writing briefs to illustrate social transfer instruments and issues.

• Responsible for helping the Team Leader to explore and develop innovative ways of exchanging information and learning with C1 and EUDs around key themes and services.

ASiST Helpdesk coordination • Work with the team to set up and manage the ASiST helpdesk, including receiving, fielding and coordinating enquiries and responses.

Qualifications, knowledge, skills and experience

Qualifications and skills • Minimum Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent.

• Experience in coordinating projects and activities operating across multiple locations.

• Experience with project communications and knowledge management.

• Experience in providing quality assurance to reports and proofing reports or written products for development agencies.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both English and French.

• Strong organisational skills with excellent attention to detail. • Proactive, resourceful, team player and able to independently manage complex tasks.

• Excellent interpersonal skills – able to establish and maintain positive working relationships.

• A strong client-service delivery approach to delivering tasks.

• Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines.

• MS Office expertise.

General professional experience • Minimum 5 years of professional experience.

• Previous experience working with European Union Delegations and DEVCO.

Specific professional experience • Minimum 5 years of professional experience in one of the following thematic areas: food security, nutrition, resilience, sustainable agriculture, rural development, social transfers. Field experience would be an advantage.

• Demonstrable understanding of DEVCO, EUD processes and PRAG rules.

• Experience working with EU-funded projects.

• Experience working in international development cooperation.

item.title: Expert 2 and 3: Data Collection Analyst on Gender Equality in Public Administration
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Study on Gender Equality in Public Administration in the Western Balkans

The overall objective of this assignment is to contribute to strengthening girl’s and women’s voice and participation in the Western Balkans, in particular, women’s empowerment and expanded participation in policy-making and leadership in the executive branch of the state. The study will cover the Western Balkans (Albania, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Kosovo*, the former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Montenegro and Serbia) and should achieve the following specific objectives:

  • Provide an overview of the current state-of-play, barriers and challenges to women’s participation in decision-making, both participation in public policy/strategy development and participation in leadership positions. The analysis will focus on the thematic area ‘strengthening voice and participation’ identified in the Gender Action Plan.

  • Analyse country-specific legal frameworks, policies and initiatives indicating major constraints and enabling factors of promoting gender equality and women’s empowerment in public administration.

  • Identify policy and programming recommendations for further action, including specific entry points for the EC to advance women’s equal participation in public administration.

Expert 2 and 3: Data Collection Analyst on Gender Equality in Public Administration (maximum 70 working days)

Education:

University Degree in relevant area such as Public Administration, Public Policy, Social and Political Sciences, Gender Studies, International Law, Development Studies, or equivalent.

General experience

  • At least 3 years of relevant professional experience one or more of the areas of gender, governance (with particular emphasis on public administration reforms), and/or data collection;
  • Experience with extensive online research;
  • Experience with quantitative research and data collection;
  • Knowledge of decision-making processes in public policy, public service delivery, institutional capacity building, human resource management policies, professional ethics and/or civil service reform would be desirable;

Specific experience

  • Good knowledge of the international framework on gender equality and women’s empowerment, particularly in the area of women’s participation in policy and decision-making and leadership;
  • Knowledge of the EU Gender Equality Policy and Gender Action Plan would be considered an asset;
  • Previous experience in the Western Balkans in issues related to public administration reform and/or gender equality will be a strong asset.

Language skills:

  • Excellent spoken and written English
  • Knowledge of any of the languages spoken in the Western Balkans would be a distinctive advantage.

item.title: Expert 2 (Senior Category):- Trade Finance Analyst/Value Chains
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance for the Formulation of Private Sector Development Support to Botswana under the 11th EDF

The global objective of the assignment is to provide assistance to the Government of Botswana and the EU Delegation in the formulation of support to private sector development to be funded under the 11th EDF NIP. The purpose of this assignment is to improve the design of the support to private sector development by reviewing the selected option as per the identification mission report and action document. The specific objectives are as follows:

  • Review the relevance, scope and focus of the project proposed and of each of its components
  • Assess institutional capacity of the organisations involved, in particular the Ministry of Investment Trade and Industry (MITI)
  • Discuss and define a programme governance structure with stakeholders
  • Contribute to the mobilisation and participation of the intermediary organisations and other institutions involved
  • Produce the Action Document, Financing Agreement, Technical and Administrative Provisions, Logical Framework, a detailed budget and ToRs to launch a tender to implement the respective work package, as applicable.

Expert 2 (Senior Category):- Trade Finance Analyst/Value Chains – 30 working days

Minimum requirements:

  • Education at least Master’s Degree Academic Level in economics, trade, finance or industrial development. In the absence of a University Degree stated above, 12 years of equivalent professional experience which must be above the general professional experience duration fixed below, are required in the area of trade and/or Private Sector Development.

General Professional Experience

  • Professional experience of up to 12 years in sectors related to Trade, Micro-Finance and capacity building for private sector including SMMEs, IOs and civil society organisations involved in economic development.

Specific professional experience:

  • 10 years' professional experience with the Access to Finance aspect of private sector development
  • Demonstrable experience in conducting market analyses, investigating constraints to competitiveness and innovation for SMMEs
  • Experience in trade related data base development and management information system development
  • Good understanding of investment environment involving SMEs, banks and intermediary organisation
  • Experience with value chain analysis and development
  • Experience in monitoring private sector development programmes is considered a distinctive advantage
  • Experience in working with public institutions and private sector organisations is an advantage

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com
